meanings.definition: Food, especially of the variety eaten by animals
meanings.sent1: The hungry squirrel found some tasty grub in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The chickens pecked at the delicious grub in the yard.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon threw a party for his friends, serving only the finest grub.
meanings.sent4: The picnic basket was filled with a feast of grub for the hungry campers.
meanings.sent5: The zookeeper prepared a special treat of grub for the animals.

meanings.definition: To dig or search for something in the ground, typically for food
meanings.sent1: The curious dog loves to grub in the backyard for buried treasures.
meanings.sent2: The gardener decided to grub around the flower bed for lost tools.
meanings.sent3: The kids pretended to be archaeologists and started to grub in the sandbox.
meanings.sent4: The detective had to grub through the evidence to find the missing clue.
meanings.sent5: The chef had to grub through the pantry to find the secret ingredient.

meanings.definition: A young insect, especially a beetle or moth, that feeds on plant roots
meanings.sent1: The gardener noticed tiny grubs eating the roots of the plants.
meanings.sent2: The farmer used a pesticide to get rid of the harmful grubs in the soil.
meanings.sent3: The beetle parent proudly watched over its newborn grub in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The moth caterpillar transformed into a beautiful butterfly from a humble grub.
meanings.sent5: The biologist studied the life cycle of the beetle grub in detail.
